result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal L. Segelstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Crystal L. Segelstrom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Crystal L. Segelstrom was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County case 21CF49

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal L. Segelstrom

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

9:15 AM Defendant Crystal L. Segelstrom in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Crystal L. Segelstrom.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1 w/3 years probation; concurrent to 21CF49. Dismiss Ct#2-3. Atty Chapman and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights . Def pleas no contest to Ct#1.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Def guilty to Ct#1; dismisses Ct#2-3. ADA Walker and Atty Chapman address sentencing- joint recommendation. Atty Chapman: Def states she's on a PO hold, in custody due to conditional jail time. Court orders S/W 3 years probation; concurrent to 21CF49- court costs ($518), Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days.  0 days credit.9:29
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
Plea hearing on August 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
filed by Atty Daniel Chapman. eif

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Atty Chapman asks to preserve rights of substitution. Court will reserve. NG. Court adjourned at 4:13 pm.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

4:09 PM Defendant Crystal L. Segelstrom appears from Jail via video, Atty Daniel James Chapman appears via zoom, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Chapman states this is a waiver. Court questions DE on waiver of PH.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DEprobably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request to Appear Remotely- Defendant filed by Atty Chapman
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center for fingerprints and photograph within the next 30 days.
Absolute sobriety.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 01:05 PM Defendant Crystal L. Segelstrom in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Daniel Chapman appeared in court.   Defendant has reviewed a copy of complaint.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives further reading. Atty Chapman wishes to plea not guilty to misd. charge. ADA walker: $10,000 signature bond with absolute sobriety. Chapman: no objection. Court orders.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
